result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Drusch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Fine to be paid at the rate of  $35.00 per month,  starting 04-01-2016 and the 1st of every  month until paid in full. 
Alternate:  4 days in the Waukesha County Jail.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael J Drusch

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Authorization to appear, received and filed in court.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Joseph Smith in court.   
Defendant Michael J Drusch did not appear.   
Attorney appeared by authorization. 

State moves to amend to a County Ordinance of DC.
Defense has no objections.

Atty. Smith enters a plea of No Contest to the amended charge on behalf of his client.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.

Court orders the following:
Fine:  $236
To be paid at the rate of $35 per month, starting 04/01/16 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate:  4 Days in the Waukesha County Jail

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Michael J Drusch in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  
Court vacates stayed warrant.
State will amend to an ordinance with proof of treatment completion.
Paperwork submitted to the State for verification.
File not called on the record.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael J Drusch
Current: 311 Oakton Avenue, Pewaukee, WI 53072 United States  (Effective: 01-07-2016)
Prior: W226n2555 Oakwood Ln, Waukesha, WI 53188

Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Joseph Smith in court.   
Defendant Michael J Drusch did not appear.   
Case scheduled for 9:30 am. and Matter called @ 10 am.

Court orders a stayed warrant to the next court date.
MANDATORY APPEARANCE BY THE DEFENDANT IS REQUIRED OR A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED.  Hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Michael J Drusch in court with attorney Joseph Smith by Atty. Katie Bricco.  
State will amend to citation with proof of a Mental Health Assessment and Follow through.
File not called on the record.
  Hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint for 72 hours.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim/witness listed in the criminal complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to supply address within 3 business days of his release to the Clerk of Courts if different than address listed.

Defendant Michael J Drusch in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
